page.title: 19DARTMOOR COTTAGE TEAS
page.content: The owner of Church Cottage provides a tea for Â£1.50 consisting of scones, clotted cream,jam,a pot of Indian tea with milk -a china tea set is used. The cottage is thought to be 17th.Cent. but the timbers in the loft are 15th.Cent.The owner retired from an Art Gallery in London and loves the simplicity and softness of life here. Two hundred locals celebrated the 1977 Jubilee on her lawn which gave rise to the idea of a Community Hall. She has raised money for this by holding whist drives in her cottage on winter evenings.She does not drive a car. Her husband is ill (stroke) and is in Newton Abbot hospital.A baker,butcher, fishman and milkman deliver. Friends collect orders from Ashburton and take her to a supermarket in Newton Abbot once a month.
